activities.loc: Br 9 - Law Enforcement Center - Lower Level

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob David Huffhines

records.addlTxt:
Charges per attached Amended criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Do not drive at all.

** AMENDED 10/27/22 to: Do not drive unless properly licensed. **

8:54 AM Defendant Jacob David Huffhines in court.  Attorney Elizabeth Martha Angove in court for Jacob David Huffhines.  Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
NG plea entered. 
Defense requests to be heard on bond conditions.
State objects
BTC: Bond modification granted
Status conference scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on December 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
